title: Q25 Punctuation MC
prompt: Which of these sentences is punctuated correctly?
feedback:
The correct answer is “Mr. Atkins has details regarding minimum system requirements, maintenance routines, and backup procedures.” The commas separate a series of three things: system requirements, maintenance routines, and backup procedures. There should be commas separating each item.

The choice “The computers’ operating systems are the newest versions; and are automatically updated” has a semicolon in the compound predicate. No punctuation is needed before the word “and.”

The choice “When new software is installed make a record of the software version, and registration key” has a comma in a series of two items. The comma is unnecessary.

The choice “Checking regularly for viruses and malware, is an important part of routine maintenance” has comma between the subject and verb; there should be no comma.
